commands.note: Clones a repository from GitHub to the local machine. Use this to quickly pull down a project.
Starts a PostgreSQL database instance in Docker. Useful for local development.
Lists the contents of an S3 bucket. Modify the bucket name as needed.
Retrieves a list of all pods in a specific Kubernetes namespace. Replace 'my-namespace' with the actual namespace.
Authenticates the Google Cloud CLI with your Google account. Needed for other gcloud operations.
Connects to the production server. Ensure you have proper permissions and a secure key configured.
Starts the development server for a Node.js project. Run this in the project root.
Installs the popular Python requests library for HTTP operations. Useful for API development.
Applies Terraform configurations to provision infrastructure. Review the plan before applying.
Tests the connectivity to all hosts defined in the Ansible inventory file. Ensure the inventory file is correct.
Tests an API endpoint with a GET request. Replace the URL and endpoint as needed.
Opens a configuration file in Vim for editing. Replace 'some_config_file' with the actual file name.
Launches htop, an interactive system-monitoring tool. Use this to monitor system processes and resource usage.
Creates a new tmux session named 'my_session'. Replace with the desired session name.
Transfers a file to a remote server using SCP. Replace 'local_file' and paths as needed.
Starts a Jupyter Notebook server in the current directory. Use this for data analysis or prototyping.
Runs all tests in the 'tests' directory using pytest. Ensure tests are properly written.
Connects to a MySQL server on localhost with the root user. Enter the password when prompted.
Lists all virtual machines in your Azure subscription in a table format. Requires Azure CLI.
Synchronizes files from a source directory to a backup directory. Modify paths as needed.
